criteria: Understanding of Rational Number Addition and Subtraction: Demonstrates comprehension of adding and subtracting rational numbers, including positive and negative fractions and decimals.
Representation on a Number Line: Accurately represents addition and subtraction of rational numbers on a horizontal or vertical number line diagram.
Application of Additive Inverses: Demonstrates understanding that a number and its opposite have a sum of 0 (additive inverses).
Interpretation in Real-World Contexts: Interprets sums and differences of rational numbers by describing relevant real-world contexts.
descriptions: Shows no understanding of adding or subtracting rational numbers. Unable to represent operations on a number line or in real-world contexts.
Struggles to add or subtract rational numbers, often making errors with signs or fractions. Difficulty representing operations on a number line or in real-world contexts.
Can add and subtract simple rational numbers with some errors. Attempts to represent operations on a number line, but with limited accuracy. Limited understanding of real-world contexts.
Adds and subtracts rational numbers with reasonable accuracy. Represents operations on a number line with minor errors. Can describe simple real-world contexts.
Accurately adds and subtracts rational numbers, including complex fractions and decimals. Represents operations effectively on a number line. Provides clear descriptions of real-world contexts.

Demonstrates a thorough understanding of adding and subtracting rational numbers. Skillfully represents operations on a number line and interprets sums and differences in complex real-world contexts with detailed explanations.
Unable to represent addition or subtraction of rational numbers on a number line.
Attempts to represent addition or subtraction on a number line, but with significant inaccuracies.
Represents addition or subtraction on a number line with frequent errors in direction or magnitude.
Represents addition and subtraction on a number line with occasional minor errors.
Accurately represents addition and subtraction on a number line, demonstrating a clear understanding of positive and negative directions.
Masterfully represents addition and subtraction on a number line, clearly illustrating the magnitude and direction of each operation with detailed labeling and explanations.
Shows no understanding of additive inverses or their properties.
Struggles to identify additive inverses and their relationship to zero.
Identifies additive inverses but has difficulty explaining their sum is zero.
Understands that additive inverses sum to zero and can provide simple examples.
Clearly explains and demonstrates that additive inverses sum to zero and can apply this concept in problem-solving.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of additive inverses, applying this concept to solve complex problems and providing insightful explanations.
Unable to interpret sums or differences of rational numbers in real-world contexts.
Struggles to relate sums or differences of rational numbers to real-world situations.
Attempts to describe real-world contexts but provides inaccurate or irrelevant interpretations.
Describes basic real-world contexts for sums and differences of rational numbers with some clarity.
Provides clear and relevant descriptions of real-world contexts for sums and differences of rational numbers.
Offers detailed and insightful interpretations of sums and differences of rational numbers in complex real-world scenarios, demonstrating a deep understanding of their practical implications.
